medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 10-hour history of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain, rated 8 out of 10 in severity, radiating to the back. The pain is described as crampy, constant, and worsens while eating fatty food. The patient reported nausea and non-bilious vomiting. She was febrile two days ago with a temperature of 101Â°F.
